results.name: Number of ways of writing n^2 as a sum of n squares.
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: a(n) equals the coefficient of x^(n^2) in the n-th power of Jacobi theta_3(x) where theta_3(x) = 1 + 2*Sum_{n>=1} x^(n^2).
